sense.def:
Kadar otroci
play
, preživljajo čas z igračami ali razvredrilnimi dejavnostmi.

seg.quote: The kids went off to play on the swings.
I played with the children all day.

sense.def:
To play a sport, game, or match
pomeni sodelovati v športu, igri ali tekmi.

seg.quote: Do you play chess?
I used to play for the village cricket team.

sense.def:
Kadar ena oseba ali moštvo
plays another person or team
, v športu ali igri tekmuje z drugim.

seg.quote: I saw Australia play against England at Lords.

sense.def:
To play a joke or a trick on someone
pomeni nekoga prevarati ali presenetiti na način, ki se nam zdi zabaven, njega pa lahko razjezi.

cit.quote: privoščiti si koga, potegniti za nos

seg.quote: I presumed someone was playing a rather silly joke.

sense.def:
Izraz
play
lahko uporabljamo tudi pri opisovanju tega, kako se nekdo vede. Na primer,
to play the innocent
pomeni pretvarjati se, da smo nedolžni;

seg.quote: Don't you play the wise old professor with me, Franz.

sense.def:
A play
je besedilo, ki ga uprizorijo v gledališču, na radiu ali televiziji.

seg.quote: Wesker has written four major plays since then.

sense.def:
Kadar igralec
plays a character
, nastopa kot določena oseba v igri ali filmu.

seg.quote: Brutus was played by James Mason.
I was asked to play in a revival of ‘Ghosts’.

sense.def:
To play a musical instrument
ali
to play a tune on a musical instrument
pomeni izvajati skladbo na glasbilu.

seg.quote: Out on the balcony, a man stood playing a trombone.
Doesn't he play beautifully?
The child played him a tune.

sense.def:
To play a record or tape
pomeni poslušati gramofonsko ploščo ali kaseto.

seg.quote: I'll play you the tape.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
plays a part
ali
plays a role in a situation
, je vpleten v določen položaj in vpliva nanj.

seg.quote: Examinations seem to play a large part in education.

sense.def:
To play it safe
pomeni ne tvegati.

seg.quote: Should I play it safe and follow the judge's order?

sense.def:
To play for time
pomeni poskušati doseči, da bi se nekaj zgodilo pozneje, tako da bi se lahko pripravili na dogajanje ali ga preprečili.

seg.quote: She was playing for time, half hoping that he would forget all about it.

sense.def:
To play along with a person
pomeni strinjati se z nekom in narediti, kot želi, čeprav nismo prepričani, da ima prav.

seg.quote: I'll play along with them for the moment.

sense.def:
To play at an activity
pomeni zlahka in ne preveč zares izvajati neko dejavnost.

seg.quote: They played at being huntsmen.
What do you think you're playing at?

sense.def:
To play back a tape or film
pomeni poslušati zvoke ali gledati slike, potem ko smo jih posneli.

To play down something
pomeni poskušati prepričati ljudi, da so stvari manj pomembne, kot so v resnici.

seg.quote: He played down his recent promotion.

sense.def:
To play people off against each other
pomeni ljudi pripraviti do tega, da tekmujejo drug z drugim ali se prepirajo, mi pa imamo zaradi tega koristi.

seg.quote: Annie played one parent off against the other.

sense.def:
To play on
ali
to play upon people's weaknesses or faults
pomeni namerno uporabiti slabosti ali napake ljudi, da dosežemo, kar želimo.

seg.quote: He used to play on their prejudices and their fears.
He found himself in a position to play upon the fears of his colleagues.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj, na primer stroj ali del telesa,
is playing up
ali
is playing someone up
, ne deluje dobro.

seg.quote: Our phone is playing up again.
Is your leg still playing you up?
